title: PepsiCo profit drops on beverage unit performance
text: Beverage and snack maker PepsiCo PEP, -2.50% said its third-quarter net income fell to $2.1 billion, or $1.49 a share, from $2.5 billion, or $1.75 a share, while revenue rose 4% to $17.19 billion. The company said its so-called core EPS was $1.56. Analysts polled by FactSet expected earnings of $1.50 a share on sales of $16.93 billion. Its largest unit, PepsiCo Beverages North America, saw its operating profit fall to $640 million from $703 million. PepsiCo said it expects to meet or exceed its full-year organic revenue growth target of 4% after third-quarter growth of 4.3%.
